ArtisanProfile.title: ArtisanProfile
ArtisanProfile.description: Represents the profile of an artisan.

id.description: Unique identifier for the ArtisanProfile entity.

Product.title: Product
Product.description: Represents a product offered by an artisan.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Product entity.

photoUrls.description: URLs of photos of the product.

tagIds.description: References to Tags. (Relationship: Tag N:N Product)

Tag.title: Tag
Tag.description: Represents a tag for categorizing products.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Tag entity.

StoryCard.title: StoryCard
StoryCard.description: Represents a story card generated for a product.

id.description: Unique identifier for the StoryCard entity.

qrCodeUrl.description: URL for the QR code for audio.

ContactMessage.title: ContactMessage
ContactMessage.description: Represents a contact message submitted by a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the ContactMessage entity.

name.description: Name of the user submitting the message.

email.description: Email of the user submitting the message.

timestamp.description: Timestamp of when the message was submitted.

CustomerReview.title: CustomerReview
CustomerReview.description: Represents a customer review for a product or artisan.

id.description: Unique identifier for the CustomerReview entity.

artisanId.description: Reference to ArtisanProfile. (Relationship: ArtisanProfile 1:N CustomerReview).  If null, then references a Product.

productId.description: Reference to Product. (Relationship: Product 1:N CustomerReview).  If null, then references an Artisan.

customerName.description: Name of the customer providing the review.

rating.description: Rating given by the customer (e.g., 1-5 stars).

reviewDate.description: Date when the review was submitted.

firestore.reasoning:
This Firestore data structure is designed to support the ArtEcho application, focusing on artisan profiles, products, and customer engagement features like reviews and contact messages. It prioritizes authorization independence through structural segregation and denormalization where necessary. The structure includes collections for artisans, products, tags, story cards, contact messages, and customer reviews. The design ensures secure data access and efficient querying while adhering to the principles of Authorization Independence (CRITICAL), Clarity of Intent (Debuggability), DBAC (No Custom Claims), QAPs (Rules are not Filters), and Invariants.

Specifically, the `contactMessages` and `customerReviews` collections are designed to support the newly requested features, "About Us" and "Contact Us" sections. The `contactMessages` collection directly stores contact form submissions. The `customerReviews` are stored to show customer feedback and maintain QAPs, these reviews can be listed and filtered as needed.

Authorization Independence:

The structure avoids hierarchical authorization dependencies (`get()`). For instance, access to a product does not depend on fetching data from the artisan's profile. While a `artisanId` field exists in the `products` collection, this is for data relationship purposes and not authorization. The QAPs are supported by the structural segregation - each collection has clear security requirements.
